Tips._LCLZText: Standard and Units cannot be changed once a drawing is created. Sheet size, however, can be adjusted at any time in Sheet Settings.

Description._LCLZText: For more control over drawing defaults, make adjustments in Preferences in your User Name drop-down in the top right.

Tips._LCLZText: Standard and Units cannot be changed once a drawing is created. Sheet size, however, can be adjusted at any time in Sheet Settings.

Description._LCLZText: For more control over drawing defaults, make adjustments in Preferences in your User Name drop-down in the top right.

Tips._LCLZText: The drawing's standard, ASME or ISO, defines the default title block. You can insert your own DWG file as a title block using Insert Title Block within Sheet Settings.

Description._LCLZText: When you insert your own title block, the origin point (0,0) in the DWG will equate to the bottom right corner of the Fusion Drawing border.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Select a view to modify its properties.

Tips._LCLZText: When moving a projected view, you can press Shift to break that view's alignment with its parent. For example, if a projected view's alignment is “locked” vertically or horizontally with a base view, you can click Move on the toolbar, select the view, then press Shift to “unlock” the alignment. Press Shift again to realign the view.

Description._LCLZText: Projected views, detail views, and section views inherit properties from their parent view. If the properties of a view change, it will no longer inherit the settings from its parent view.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Generates a base view of the referenced design.

Tips._LCLZText: Generates a drawing view that is derived from your selected 3D model. You can use a base view as a parent for other views.

Description._LCLZText: Base view orientation can only be set during creation, while other attributes can be modified afterwards. Make sure the view orientation is how you'd like it before clicking OK.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Generates a base view placeholder.
When the drawing template is used to create a new drawing, the placeholder is updated to show the referenced design.
Generates projected orthogonal and isometric views.
Select a parent view, click to place projected views, then press Enter. The position of the cursor determines the type of projected view you create.
Generates projected and isometric view placeholders.
When the drawing template is used to create a new drawing, the placeholders are updated to show the referenced design.
Generates a simple (single segment cutting plane) section view from a drawing view.
Select a parent view, then specify the section line's start and end points, and then specify the insertion point for your section view.
Generates a full, half, offset, or aligned section view.
Use a section line to cut through a drawing view in order to reveal what is inside.

Tips._LCLZText: Click to specify the path of the section line. When complete, press Enter to generate the section view, then click to place it.

Description._LCLZText: To modify a section view, click an existing section line and adjust the gray grips. If the path of the section line changes, the section view automatically updates.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Shows a specific portion of a view at an enlarged scale.
Select a parent view, specify the center point, specify the detail boundary, then place the detail view.

Tips._LCLZText: Specify the center point of the area to magnify, specify the size of the boundary, then click to place the detail view. Modify the scale and edge visibility properties and click OK when done.

Description._LCLZText: If you select the detail view boundary, you can use the gray grips to reposition the boundary. The detail view automatically updates.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Select objects to move, then click Transform. Then specify a base point and a second point.

Tips._LCLZText: Click and drag to select multiple objects. A selection box from left to right will select all objects completely within the box. A selection box from right to left will select all objects partially within the box.

Description._LCLZText: Deselect objects by holding Shift while dragging across or clicking objects.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Select objects to rotate, then click Transform. Then specify a base point and a rotation angle.

Tips._LCLZText: After specifying a base point, click Reference Selection to define a reference angle along an edge or between any two points.

Description._LCLZText: If you want to redefine your selected objects or re-specify the base point without canceling the command, click Selection to return to Selection mode.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Select objects to delete, then press Enter.

Tips._LCLZText: Click and drag to select multiple objects. A selection box from left to right will select all objects completely within the box. A selection box from right to left will select all objects partially within the box.

Description._LCLZText: Deselect objects by holding Shift while dragging across or clicking objects.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Select a hatch to modify its properties.

Tips._LCLZText: Double-click a hatch to modify the hatch properties of a section view. Edit the hatch pattern, the scale factor, and the angle of the hatch pattern.

Description._LCLZText: Each hatch has its own properties. You can only modify one hatch pattern at a time.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Select a dimension to modify its properties.

Tips._LCLZText: To change the settings for all dimensions on a sheet, use Annotation Settings at the bottom of the drawing area.

Description._LCLZText: You can restore default properties if you modify the precision, alternate units, or tolerance type. Select the dimension, right-click to access the marking menu, and select Restore Defaults.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Measures the horizontal or vertical distance between two points. Create dimensions by selecting an edge or by selecting two points.
Measures the precise distance between two points. Create dimensions that are parallel to the locations or objects that you specify.
Measures the angle of a rounded edge or the angle between two points or edges.
Select a rounded edge, such as a fillet, hole, sphere, or cylinder, then place the dimension.
Select a rounded edge, such as a fillet, hole, sphere, or cylinder, then place the dimension.
Select an existing linear dimension, then specify a point to create a new dimension.
Continue specifying points to create multiple dimensions all originating from the same base point.
Select an existing linear dimension, then specify a point to create a new dimension.
Continue specifying points to create multiple side-by-side dimensions.
Define view origins and place ordinate dimensions referencing them.
Select two straight edges. An edge extension is created for each edge that terminates at their intersection.
Select existing dimensions or leaders, then add or remove breaks where they overlap other dimensions and leaders.

Tips._LCLZText: Right-click on selected dimesnions to create Dimension Breaks.

Description._LCLZText: Dimension Break breaks the selected intersecting dimensions at the intersection points. You can also add a Dimension Break to other objects like Balloons, Bend Identifiers, and Leaders.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Specify the corners for the text box, then enter text. When finished, click outside the text editor.

Tips._LCLZText: You can include special characters and symbols by entering a control code or a Unicode string.

Description._LCLZText: You can control the font style and text height for all annotations in the drawing by clicking Annotation Settings at the bottom of the drawing area.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Specify the corners for the text box, then enter text. When finished, click outside the text editor.

Tips._LCLZText: You can include special characters and symbols by entering a control code or a Unicode string.

Description._LCLZText: You can control the font style and text height for all annotations in the drawing by clicking Annotation Tools at the bottom of the drawing area.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Specify the arrowhead location, specify the location of the text, then enter text. When finished, click outside the text editor.

Tips._LCLZText: You can include special characters and symbols by entering a control code or a Unicode string.

Description._LCLZText: You can control the font style and text height for all annotations in the drawing by clicking Annotation Settings at the bottom of the drawing area.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Specify the arrowhead location, specify the location of the text, then enter text. When finished, click outside the text editor.

Tips._LCLZText: You can include special characters and symbols by entering a control code or a Unicode string.

Description._LCLZText: You can control the font style and text height for all annotations in the drawing by clicking Annotation Tools at the bottom of the drawing area.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a leader within the sketch.
Specify the leader's start point, then its end point.
Insert a blank table to add data manually.

Tips._LCLZText: When a cell is selected, double-click to edit the cell text. You can also start entering text when a cell is highlighted to replace its current content.

Description._LCLZText: To change the width of a column without changing the width of other columns, select a cell and use the grips that appear around that particular cell. The overall width of the table changes but the other columns maintain the same width. To change the width of a column without changing the overall width of the table, select the whole table by clicking on table or cell border and use the grips that appear on table columns.

Tips._LCLZText: You can include special characters and symbols by entering a control code or a Unicode string.

Description._LCLZText: You can control the font style and text height for all annotations in the drawing by clicking Annotation Tools at the bottom of the drawing area.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Select two straight edges. The centerline is created between them.
Select a rounded edge, such as a fillet, hole, sphere, or cylinder.
Select rounded edges, such as holes or fillets. A center mark pattern including a PCD is created.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the edges of features (e.g. holes) in the appropriate order to form the required center mark pattern. The Auto-complete checkbox is checked by default. The Center Mark Pattern is created automatically when you click just one hole or rounded edge.

Description._LCLZText: A Reference Edge has to be selected while creating a center mark pattern for a slot.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Select an existing centermark pattern for editing.
Creates linear, aligned, angular, radius, and diameter dimensions.
Select objects, points, edges, existing dimensions, or select two points. Then place the dimension. The most appropriate dimension type is created.
Generates a parts list of the model associated to the drawing.

Tips._LCLZText: A parts list that is placed in the bottom half of the drawing sheet will flip its numbering, so that the parts are numbered from bottom to top. To lock or unlock flipping, press Shift.

Description._LCLZText: To change the part number and description of a component, modify the component's properties in the Model workspace.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Generates a parts list for single component, assembly and animation references, and bend tables for sheet metal flat patterns references.

Tips._LCLZText: A parts list that is placed in the bottom half of the drawing sheet will flip its numbering, so that the parts are numbered from bottom to top. To lock or unlock flipping, press Shift.

Description._LCLZText: To change the part number and description of a component, modify the component's properties in the Model workspace.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Select a component within a drawing view, then place the balloon.
Select a component within a drawing view, then place the balloon.
Specify a starting number, then select existing balloons or bend identifiers.
Balloons and bend identifiers are renumbered based on the order they are selected. Parts lists and bend tables will automatically sort based on the renumbering.
Select existing balloons to align, then specify two points.
Balloons are aligned and distributed equally between the two points.
Creates a DWG file of the current drawing.

Tips._LCLZText: Hold either the Shift or Ctrl keys to select multiple sheets on the sheet bar to output a DWG.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a DXF file of the current drawing.

Tips._LCLZText: Hold either the Shift or Ctrl keys to select multiple sheets on the sheet bar to output a DXF
Add a new sheet which by default inherits the properties of the active sheet, or select the desired options.

Description._LCLZText: Right-click anywhere within the sheet bar to add a new sheet there.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a PDF file of the current drawing.

Tips._LCLZText: Hold either the Shift or Ctrl keys to select multiple sheets on the sheet bar to output a PDF. Check the Open PDF check box to open the PDF when the output is done.
Hold either the Shift or Ctrl keys to select multiple sheets on the sheet bar to output a PDF. Check the Open PDF check box to open the PDF when the output is done.
Hold either the Shift or Ctrl keys to select multiple sheets on the sheet bar to output a PDF. Check the Open PDF check box to open the PDF when the output is done.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a drawing template of the current drawing configuration that can be used when creating new drawings.
A template retains the current drawing's drafting standard, annotation and sheet settings, title block, and border. All drawing views, associated annotations, and parts lists are removed.
Creates a CSV file of the selected table
Select an edge, or an existing dimension, or an existing feature control frame symbol, then place the datum identifier.

Tips._LCLZText: Symbols can be added from the text field in the drop-down menu.

Description._LCLZText: To create a surface symbol in an ISO drawing, select an object, right-click to activate the marking menu, and select Surface.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Inserts the selected image into the current sheet.
Edits the selected image into the current sheet.
Closes the editor and returns to the drawing or drawing template.
Inserts the selected image into the current block definition.
Inserts the selected image into the current sheet.
Select either an edge or an existing dimension, then place the feature control frame.

Tips._LCLZText: Symbols can be added from the text field in the drop-down menu.

Description._LCLZText: To create a surface symbol in an ISO drawing, select an object, right-click to activate the marking menu, and select Surface.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Select an edge, or an existing dimension, or an existing feature control frame symbol, then place the surface texture.

Tips._LCLZText: The available properties in the dialog box depend on which symbol type is selected, and the drafting standard in use.

Description._LCLZText: To attach a surface texture to a surface in an ISO drawing, select an object, right-click to activate the marking menu, and select Surface.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Edit a symbol.
Select a bend centerline within a flat pattern drawing view. A bend identifier is created.
Reports distance, angle and positional data for the selected points.
Creates straight lines.
Specify the line's start point, then specify a second point to define its angle and length.
Creates a rectangle using 2 diagonal points.
Specify the rectangle's start point, then specify a second point to define its width and height.
Creates a circle using its center point and radius.
Specify the circle's center point, then specify a second point to define its radius.
Creates an arc using 3 points.
Specify the arc's start point, middle point and end point.
Creates an ellipse.

The first two points of the ellipse determine the location and length of the first axis. The third point determines the distance between the center of the ellipse and the end point of the second axis.
Select objects to copy, specify a base point, then specify a second point to define the copy's location.
Select the objects to trim. All objects automatically become cutting boundaries.
Select the objects to extend. All objects automatically become extension boundaries.
Select the object to offset, enter the offset distance, then specify a point to define to side.
Specify a point then enter the attribute's prompt. When finished, click outside the text editor.
Enters Sketch mode and creates a new sketch on the current sheet.
Select Finish Sketch to exit out of the mode.
Closes the sketch editing mode.

Tips._LCLZText: View or change document settings related to standards, units, text, dimensions, and line widths for the current drawing.

Description._LCLZText: Some document settings are read-only, because they can only be set when you first create a drawing, or they are controlled by a standard.

Tips._LCLZText: Change the sheet size and title block for the current drawing.

Description._LCLZText: You can create as many title blocks as you need and switch between them. You can also toggle the border and title block on or off independently.

Tips._LCLZText: Create a new title block based on an existing title block, from scratch, or from a DWG file.

Description._LCLZText: After you select a source and click OK, the Title Block contextual environment opens, where you can create and modify geometry and text to customize the title block.
